abstract: Gerry Wang, head of shipping company Seaspan, warns that ports on East Coast of United States planning to use Panama Canal extension are years away from being ready to absorb traffic from congested ports on West Coast.
lead_paragraph: U.S. East Coast ports planning to use the Panama Canal expansion to lure traffic from congested West Coast ports are years away from being ready for extra business, a shipping executive said.

headline.main: Plan to Ease Carrier Traffic Is Behind Schedule
headline.print_headline: Plan to Ease Carrier Traffic Is Behind Schedule

snippet: U.S. East Coast ports planning to use the Panama Canal expansion to lure traffic from congested West Coast ports are years away from being ready for extra business, a shipping executive said.
